channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from multiple RSS sources, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Receivership Real Estate: The Hidden Inventory Only Experts Know About w/Jake Flothe
item.description: When housing inventory is low, where do you go? Foreclosure rates are down, short sales are a hassle, and the open housing market has barely any sellers—is there a better […]

item.title: Apple iPad event 2024: Watch Apple unveil new iPads right here
item.description: We’re still well over a month out from WWDC, but Apple went ahead and snuck in another event. On Tuesday, May 7 at 7AM PT/10AM ET, the company is set to unveil the latest additions to the iPad line. According to the rumor mill, that list includes: a new iPad Pro, iPad Air, Apple Pencil […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Killed Their Abusive Partners. Now Their Sentences Could Be Reconsidered.
item.description: Oklahoma could re-examine how it punishes people whose crimes came after years of domestic abuse. Other states may follow.

item.title: You Give Me (Spring) Fever
item.description: New Season Brings Boost of Energy, but Also Unplanned Pregnancies

item.title: $80,000/Year Cash Flow & Financial Freedom with 7 Properties (in 3 Years!) w/Sarah Msuya
item.description: What’s YOUR reason for investing in real estate? For today’s guest, it was to achieve financial freedom and have a flexible schedule. By focusing on education, forming partnerships, and, most […]

item.title: Inside the ‘cold war’ at Techstars as CEO Mäelle Gavet hires, fires, fights to force change
item.description: Financial losses, founder revolts, public firings and overflowing office sewage mark the storied institution’s annus horribilis. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What Being Trans in Prison Is Really Like
item.description: Amid a wave of anti-trans legislation, and the violence that often follows, four people share their experiences in the criminal justice system.

item.title: Older Adults: 9 Nutrients You May Be Missing
item.description: With age, your body doesn’t absorb nutrients well, so every calorie you consume must be packed with nutrition. Here are 9 nutrients older adults often need more of.

item.title: 3 Ways We Find Real Estate Deals Even During the Harshest Housing Markets
item.description: It seems like everyone is wondering how to find real estate deals in today’s supply-constrained market. With housing inventory still hovering around historical lows, finding a cash-flowing, appreciating rental property […]

item.title: Google lays off staff from Flutter, Dart and Python teams weeks before its developer conference
item.description: Google told TechCrunch that Flutter will have new updates to share at I/O this year. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Enduring Use of Solitary, and New Proposed Limits That Will Likely Fail (Again)
item.description: Isolation’s damaging effects are widely known. But many facilities confine people — even youth — virtually all day, sometimes in shower stalls.

item.title: The Immunity Challenge: How aging affects your immune system
item.description: How does getting older affect your immune system? How can you keep those effects to a minimum? Your answers are here.

item.title: Think Passive Real Estate Is Safe? Here Are 9 Hidden Risks That Could Cost You
item.description: You can’t eliminate all risk from investments. After all, the zombie apocalypse could strike tomorrow and probably wipe out your entire portfolio. But you can reduce risk, even among high-return […]

item.title: Fisker starts new round of layoffs to ‘preserve cash’
item.description: EV startup Fisker Inc. is laying off more employees to “preserve cash,” one week after warning investors it would have to make cuts to stave off impending bankruptcy, according to an internal email viewed by TechCrunch. Founder and CEO Henrik Fisker told employees Monday morning in the email that the company is “continuing to evaluate […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Officials Failed to Act When COVID Hit Prisons. A New Study Shows the Deadly Cost.
item.description: People in prison died at 3.4 times the rate of the free population, with the oldest hit hardest. New data holds lessons for preventing future deaths.

item.title: What Helps When It’s Hard to Chew and Swallow?
item.description: Trouble chewing and swallowing? WebMD shares six ways to make everything go down a little easier.

item.title: Gen Z Is Dominating Their Parents in Homeownership—According to New Report
item.description: When it comes to homeownership, Gen Z might be ahead of the curve. According to data from real estate firm Redfin, more Gen Zers owned their home at 24 than their parents did (millennials and […]

item.title: Epic Games says it will bring Fortnite to iPad after EU dubs iPadOS a ‘gatekeeper’ under DMA
item.description: Whether or not Epic Games will be able to bring Fortnite to the iPhone and iPad as planned still remains to be seen. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Parents Paying for Their Children’s Crimes
item.description: Experts warn about a wave of legal consequences for parents like the Crumbleys, while some states consider prosecutions for kids as young as 10.

item.title: Foods to Keep You Healthy as You Age
item.description: Staying healthy as you enter your golden years has a lot to do with your diet. Here are some foods that are good for your heart, your brain, your bones, and your muscles.
